title: Facioscapulohumeral Muscular Dystrophy (FSHD) - Clinical Overview
short_description: Clinical document discussing FSHD prevalence, demographics, and differential diagnosis with other genetic neuromuscular diseases.
long_description: This clinical document provides an overview of Facioscapulohumeral Muscular Dystrophy (FSHD), detailing its epidemiological characteristics including equal prevalence between males and females and an estimated occurrence of 4-10 per 100,000 people. The document focuses on differential diagnosis, comparing FSHD with other genetic neuromuscular diseases that present with similar symptoms such as muscle weakness, muscle atrophy, and associated complications. It specifically mentions conditions including myofibrillar myopathy, inclusion body myositis, mitochondrial myopathies, congenital myopathies, and polymyositis, emphasizing the importance of distinguishing characteristic features for accurate diagnosis.
